timeline: Approximately 2-3 weeks after Chapter 6, after multiple sales to The Collector
location: Jax's new apartment in Sector 4, Level 9, and Dr. Yin's clinic in Sector 9

knows: Identity brokers exist who claim to create Beta credentials for 2 million credits
Level 7 has parks with real trees, clean air, professional Beta class
Dr. Yin told him scanners read actual DNA, not credentials
Genetic rewrite would take years, cost 50+ billion, 70% mortality rate
Complete genetic rewrite is detectable and carries death sentence
There's an understaffed checkpoint on Level 8 during third shift (rumor)
Scanner glitches might happen during solar flares (rumor)
He's been high on pharmaceutical-grade Drift for three days straight
Jax Varro.emotional_state: Desperately hopeful, in denial, high on Drift, clinging to fantasy of escape despite warnings
Jax Varro.physical_state: Addicted to pharmaceutical-grade Drift, using heavily, cycling between high and comedown
Jax Varro.wealth: 412.7 million credits, minus 2 million sent to identity broker
Jax Varro.internal_conflict: Knows deep down he can't escape but refuses to accept it

knows: Jax has been high for three days planning his escape
Jax is in denial about genetic barriers
Jax hasn't considered anyone else in his escape plans
They were offered a cut of the money
Jax's self-hatred is driving his desperation to become Beta
Finn.emotional_state: Concerned, frustrated, trying to reality-check Jax, sad about his self-hatred
Finn.philosophy: Doesn't want to pretend to be Beta, sees it as different cage

knows: He's planning to try to escape the undercity
She educated him about how scanners work and why genetic modification isn't viable
Dr. Yin.background: Gamma-caste with manual dexterity modifications, ancestor was surgeon

revealed_to_reader: He's moved to a new apartment with real furniture, hot water, three rooms, real windows
Pharmaceutical-grade Drift (what Alphas use) is smoother and three times stronger
Jax has been high for three days straight
Level 7 is professional Beta class - engineers, administrators, medical technicians
Level 7 has parks with real trees, hydroponically grown in biodomes
Identity brokers exist on Level 6 who sell Beta credentials for 2 million credits
Jax's self-hatred drives his desire to escape being Gamma
Finn doesn't want to leave - sees pretending to be Beta as 'different cage'
Dr. Yin runs unofficial clinic in Sector 9, treats undercity residents
Gamma modifications are in mitochondrial DNA, passed down maternally
Scanners read actual genetic code and compare to genetic registry
Complete genetic rewrite takes years, costs 50+ billion, 70% mortality, detectable, death sentence
Undercity has few children because people can't afford to have them
Jax has sent 2 million to an identity broker for fake Beta credentials
He's supposed to pick up the documents in three days with 1 million in physical scrip
Immigration forums exist with advice (mostly useless) about moving between levels

planted.element: Identity broker and fake Beta credentials
planted.significance: The credentials won't work with the scanner

planted.element: Dr. Yin's explanation about scanners reading DNA not credentials
planted.significance: Foreshadows exactly what will happen when Jax tries to pass through

planted.element: Understaffed checkpoint on Level 8 during third shift
planted.significance: Where Jax will attempt to cross
Character flaw that drives much of trilogy, needs to overcome this

planted.element: Finn's refusal to pretend to be Beta
planted.significance: Shows Finn has healthier relationship with identity than Jax

planted.element: Fantasy of Level 7 parks and trees
planted.significance: What Jax will mourn losing when he realizes he's trapped

planted.element: Finn warning 'when you try to leave and scanners reject you, it will break something'
planted.significance: Direct foreshadowing of emotional devastation to come

active_tensions: Jax's desperate hope versus inevitable rejection
Knowledge that scanners read DNA versus belief that money can solve it
Finn's attempts to reality-check versus Jax's denial
Three-day countdown to picking up fake credentials
Money that can buy everything except what he actually needs
Jax's isolation - not considering anyone else in his planning
Fantasy of Level 7 life versus reality of genetic imprisonment
world_changes: Jax has upgraded to expensive apartment with real furniture
He's using pharmaceutical-grade Drift now, much stronger
He's sent 2 million to identity broker
Three days until he receives fake Beta credentials
His relationship with Finn is strained by his self-absorption
continuity_notes: Timeline: 2-3 weeks after first Collector sale, multiple sales have occurred
Jax has spent money on apartment, furniture, pharmaceutical Drift
Dr. Yin's clinic location established in Sector 9
Level 7 details established: Beta professional class, parks with trees
Finn explicitly offered money but refuses to buy Beta identity
Jax has been high continuously for three days
Next chapter will be pickup of credentials and attempt to cross checkpoint
